text: Case one is a 24-year-old male with left tibial plateau and reverse Segond fracture with an magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) showing MCL avulsion, medial meniscus entrapped in fracture site and ACL tear but intact PCL. The second case is a 56-year-old female showing reverse Segond and lateral tibial plateau fracture confirmed by X-ray and computed tomography scan. MRI revealed intact PCL, detached medial meniscus from peripheral capsule and ACL injury.
